item.description:
College costs continue to grow every year at both public and private colleges, often at twice the rate of general inflation.The University System of New Hampshire’s Financial Affairs Committee voted last week to approve tuition hikes for the state’s public colleges and universities for the 2012-13 school year. .Under the revised cost plan, students at the University of New Hampshire, Keene State College and Plymouth State University would see an increase of about 6 percent for tuition, fees, and room and board. Tuition at Granite State College is expected to rise about 3.6 percent for each credit hour.

In this seminar on College Planning, you'll learn:

  • How much college will cost in the future
  • Tax-advantaged ways to save for college, including 529 plans, Coverdell education savings accounts, custodial accounts and U.S. savings bonds
  • The role of financial aid, including how need is determined and how assets are classified for federal aid purposes
  • Other ways to fill the college funding gap

You'll also receive a free workbook created just for this presentation. The workbook contains key information, worksheets, and questions to help you remember important points from the seminar.

 

Drift Away Restaurant

219 Lafayette Road (Route 1)
North Hampton, New Hampshire
603-379-8180

 Please join us as an evening buffet will be served.. Seating is limited so please RSVP as soon as possible. 

We look forward to seeing you there!
item.how_to_find_us: Presentation will be in th private Dining Room
item.name: College Savings Dinner Presentation
